intro: Lecythis usitata var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lecythis, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The tree produces heavy, woody fruits that contain a single, oily seed. Its bark and seeds have been used traditionally for their medicinal properties. The plant is also valued for its durable wood and ecological role in rainforest habitats.
